name: sacct
description: Displays accounting data for all jobs and job steps in the SLURM job accounting log or SLURM database.

parameterdefs.name: allusers
parameterdefs.description: Displays all users jobs when run by user root or if PrivateData is not configured to jobs. Otherwise display the current user's jobs.

parameterdefs.name: accounts
parameterdefs.description: Displays jobs when a comma separated list of accounts are given as the argument.

parameterdefs.name: brief
parameterdefs.description: Displays a brief listing, which includes the following data: jobid, status, exitcode

parameterdefs.name: completion
parameterdefs.description: Use job completion instead of job accounting. The JobCompType parameter in the slurm.conf file must be defined to a non-none option.

parameterdefs.name: duplicates
parameterdefs.description: If SLURM job ids are reset, some job numbers will probably appear more than once in the accounting log file but refer to different jobs. Such jobs can be distinguished by the 'submit' time stamp in the data records.  When data for specific jobs are requested with the --jobs option, sacct returns the most recent job with that number. This behavior can be overridden by specifying --duplicates, in which case all records that match the selection criteria will be returned.

parameterdefs.name: helpformat
parameterdefs.description: Print a list of fields that can be specified with the --format option.

parameterdefs.name: endtime
parameterdefs.description: Select jobs in any state before the specified time. If states are given with the -s option return jobs in this state before this period.  Valid time formats are:  HH:MM[:SS] [AM|PM]; MMDD[YY] or MM/DD[/YY] or MM.DD[.YY]; MM/DD[/YY]-HH:MM[:SS]; YYYY-MM-DD[THH:MM[:SS]]

parameterdefs.name: file
parameterdefs.description: Causes the sacct command to read job accounting data from the named file instead of the current SLURM job accounting log file. Only applicable when running the filetxt plugin.

parameterdefs.name: groups
parameterdefs.description: Displays the statistics only for the jobs started with the GID or the GROUP specified by the gid_list or thegroup_list operand, which is a comma-separated list. Space characters are not allowed. Default is no restrictions.

parameterdefs.name: help
parameterdefs.description: Displays a general help message.

parameterdefs.name: jobs
parameterdefs.description: Displays information about the specified job(.step) or list of job(.step)s.

parameterdefs.name: timelimit-min
parameterdefs.description: Only send data about jobs with this timelimit. If used with timelimit_max this will be the minimum timelimit of the range. Default is no restriction.

parameterdefs.name: timelimit-max
parameterdefs.description: Ignored by itself, but if timelimit_min is set this will be the maximum timelimit of the range. Default is no restriction.

parameterdefs.name: long
parameterdefs.description: Equivalent to specifying: --format=jobid,jobname,partition,maxvmsize,maxvmsizenode,maxvmsizetask, avevmsize,maxrss,maxrssnode,maxrsstask,averss,maxpages,maxpagesnode, maxpagestask,avepages,mincpu,mincpunode,mincputask,avecpu,ntasks, alloccpus,elapsed,state,exitcode,maxdiskread,maxdiskreadnode,maxdiskreadtask, avediskread,maxdiskwrite,maxdiskwritenode,maxdiskwritetask,avediskwrite, allocgres,reqgres

parameterdefs.name: allclusters
parameterdefs.description: Display jobs ran on all clusters. By default, only jobs ran on the cluster from where sacct is called are displayed.

parameterdefs.name: clusters
parameterdefs.description: Displays the statistics only for the jobs started on the clusters specified by the cluster_list operand, which is a comma-separated list of clusters. Space characters are not allowed in the cluster_list. Use -1 for all clusters. The default is current cluster you are executing the sacct command on.

parameterdefs.name: noheader
parameterdefs.description: No heading will be added to the output. The default action is to display a header.

parameterdefs.name: nodelist
parameterdefs.description: Display jobs that ran on any of these node(s). node_list can be a ranged string.

parameterdefs.name: name
parameterdefs.description: Display jobs that have any of these name(s).

parameterdefs.name: format
parameterdefs.description: Comma separated list of fields.

parameterdefs.name: parsable
parameterdefs.description: output will be '|' delimited with a '|' at the end

parameterdefs.name: parsable2
parameterdefs.description: output will be '|' delimited without a '|' at the end

parameterdefs.name: qos
parameterdefs.description: Only send data about jobs using these qos. Default is all.

parameterdefs.name: partitions
parameterdefs.description: Comma separated list of partitions to select jobs and job steps from. The default is all partitions.

parameterdefs.name: state
parameterdefs.description: Selects jobs based on their state during the time period given.

parameterdefs.name: starttime
parameterdefs.description: Select jobs in any state after the specified time. Default is 00:00:00 of the current day, unless '-s' is set then the default is 'now'. If states are given with the '-s' option then only jobs in this state at this time will be returned.  Valid time formats are: HH:MM[:SS] [AM|PM]; MMDD[YY] or MM/DD[/YY] or MM.DD[.YY]; MM/DD[/YY]-HH:MM[:SS]; YYYY-MM-DD[THH:MM[:SS]]

parameterdefs.name: truncate
parameterdefs.description: Truncate time. So if a job started before --starttime the start time would be truncated to --starttime. The same for end time and --endtime.

parameterdefs.name: users
parameterdefs.description: Use this comma separated list of uids or user names to select jobs to display. By default, the running user's uid is used.

parameterdefs.name: usage
parameterdefs.description: Display a command usage summary.

parameterdefs.name: verbose
parameterdefs.description: Primarily for debugging purposes, report the state of various variables during processing.

parameterdefs.name: version
parameterdefs.description: Print version

parameterdefs.name: wckeys
parameterdefs.description: Displays the statistics only for the jobs started on the wckeys specified by the wckey_list operand, which is a comma-separated list of wckey names. Space characters are not allowed in the wckey_list. Default is all wckeys.

parameterdefs.name: associations
parameterdefs.description: Displays the statistics only for the jobs running under the association ids specified by the assoc_list operand, which is a comma-separated list of association ids. Space characters are not allowed in the assoc_list. Default is all associations.

parameterdefs.name: allocations
parameterdefs.description: Only show cumulative statistics for each job, not the intermediate steps.
